variant.question: For the first issue of a Flight Test Rating, Applicants shall...

options.text: have completed at least 1500 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category, of which at least 400 hours as PIC.
have completed at least 1000 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category, of which at least 500 hours as PIC.
have completed at least 1500 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category, of which at least 500 hours as PIC.
have completed at least 1000 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category, of which at least 400 hours as PIC.

variant.question: What must an applicant for an aerobatic rating have completed?

options.text: At least 30 hours of flight time as PIC in aeroplanes or TMGs.
At least 40 hours of flight time as PIC and 60 take-offs and landings in aeroplanes.
At least 30 hours of flight time as PIC and 50 take-offs and landings in aeroplanes.
At least 40 hours of flight time as PIC in aeroplanes or TMGs.

variant.question: If you wish to apply for a banner towing rating, you shall have completed...

options.text: at least 200 hours of flight time and 100 take-offs and landings as PIC on aeroplanes or TMG, after the issue of the licence.
at least 100 hours of flight time and 200 take-offs and landings as PIC on aeroplanes or TMG, after the issue of the licence.
at least 150 hours of flight time and 250 take-offs and landings as PIC on aeroplanes or TMG, after the issue of the licence.
at least 50 hours of flight time and 100 take-offs and landings as PIC on aeroplanes or TMG, after the issue of the licence.

variant.question: What is the requirement for the holder of the rating to be able to exercise the privileges of the sailplane or banner towing ratings?

options.text: He/She shall have completed a minimum of 10 tows during the last 24 months.
He/She shall have completed a minimum of 5 tows during the last 12 months.
He/She shall have completed a minimum of 10 tows during the last 12 months.
He/She shall have completed a minimum of 5 tows during the last 24 months.

variant.question: Two of the requirements for the issuance of an ATPL(A) licence are...

options.text: 100 hours of flight time in a simulator with a maximum of 30 hours in an FNPT.
75 hours of flight time in a simulator with a maximum of 30 hours in an FNPT.
100 hours of flight time in a simulator with a maximum of 25 hours in an FNPT.
250 hours of flight time in a simulator with a maximum of 70 hours in an FNPT.

variant.question: According to the relevant FCL requirements, the applicant for an ATPL(A) shall have demonstrated the ability to perform as pilot-in-command, the procedures and manoeuvres of an aeroplane type certificated for...

options.text: a minimum crew of two pilots under IFR.
a minimum crew of two pilots plus a flight engineer.
the carriage of passengers at night.
operations by pilots under training.

variant.question: If an applicant wishes to obtain an aeroplane night rating, He/She shall have completed...

options.text: at least 3 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category at night and 3 solo take-offs and 3 solo full-stop landings.
at least 5 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category at night and 5 solo take-offs and 5 solo full-stop landings.
at least 3 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category at night and 5 solo take-offs and 5 solo landings (at least 1 full-stop landing).
at least 5 hours of flight time in the appropriate aircraft category at night and 5 solo take-offs and 5 solo landings (at least 1 full-stop landing).

variant.question: What is the minimum amount of night flight hours as pilot-in-command or as co-pilot that an applicant for an Airline Transport Pilot Licence (ATPL) shall have completed?
According to FCL requirements for the issue of the ATPL(A), of the required 1500 hours of total flight time, the minimum instrument time shall be..

options.text: 75 hours, of which not more than 20 hours may be instrument ground time.
100 hours, of which not more than 30 hours may be instrument ground time.
75 hours, of which not more than 30 hours may be instrument ground time.
150 hours, of which not more than 75 hours may be instrument ground time.

variant.question: According to FCL requirements for the issue of the ATPL(A) or (H), of the required hours of total flight time, the minimum night flight time as PIC or as co-pilot shall be..

options.text: 75 hours.
150 hours.
125 hours.
100 hours.
